ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned more about what types of projects faculty in this department are working on. It was helpful to discuss professional skills necessary for pursuing American Studies, and to discuss methods for learning or approaching research.

I learned valuable skills and insights from this course. The design of the course was a great opportunity for first years to get to know faculty in our department and those who do research in American Scholars. The greatest benefits of the course were the diverse group of readings from faculty with different research interests and methods.
Expanded knowledge of field of American Studies, research methodologies, and writing practices.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would have appreciated a more basic history of the contours of the field as well as a discussion of some of the theories/ideas that are foundational to the field. Though sometimes alluded to, I'd also appreciate a more explicit discussion of the debates going on within the field. That said, I definitely benefited from having a more informal course to get my feet wet this first semester.

The strengths of the class are the the opportunity students got to interview faculty and engaging with their work, and being able to discuss their projects in a seminar setting. There was no weakness of the course. In my opinion.

This class served as an excellent Intro to American Studies. I appreciated hearing from scholars in the field and reading texts that were meaningful to them. I also really appreciated reading works in progress and found that to be a real privilege.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: For first-year American Studies students, yes.
This course is a must for anyone interested in American Studies. The course opens students up to the diverse kinds of research and multidisciplinary work being done in the field.
Yes, I would recommend this class to any emerging American Studies scholar because it is a great foundation.
